Posts.Content: I will make this long story short. For 2 years i have had a greenish brown discharge from my left breast with pain around my chest around and up undermy arm. I have ben to 8 different dr. all told me don't worry about get yourannual mamos. I went to a new dr. and he did blodd work and a skull xray. Blood came back fine . but the xray shows 2 secondary lesions that or consist with breast cancer. I have never been diagnosed with brest cancer even though it runs high in my family ) mom and sister . Next week he will do a biospy of the milk duct but could this have been canceralong and now it has spread. has anyone ever had or heard of this any info would be great
Posts.Title: Info told mets to the brain

Posts.Content: Hello ya'll  Thanks for all the responds. I went to my doctor today and I think the light bulb finally went on in his head!!  Actually he is the only person I think that trying to help. Yes i did a skull xray and he gave me a copy of the report today. Basicaly this is what it says several lucent areeas with one to the left paritetal bone near the vertex and possibly on the right side. No evidence of increasd intracranial pressure or abnormal intracrancial calcifications. Impression: 2 small lucent areas seen within the calvarium . these could possivbly be represnet incidental partial foramina, although if patient has history of breast cancer, metastic change cannot be excluded. I am really not sure what all this means but.... after my husband told him that my mom and my sister were both told to wait and  see its probably nothing  ended up being cancer ( my sister had bc and then lyomyscarcoma  she passed away at the age of 36), and my told told him out of 6 daughter me and another one of my sister are the only one that haven't had to have mestomy.  In a matter of a 1/2 hour  he schedule me for a MRI at 1:45 today, Bone Scan tomoorw morning 8:00 and he will do a breast biopsy and remove all the milk duct on my left breast  Monday morning. i will keep ya'll posted on what the finding are.
Posts.Title: Info told mets to the brain

Posts.Content: On 4/4/2006 AnitaCarroll B. wrote: Please don't put off having a mammogram and/or ultrasound. At your age, nipple discharge is more than likely something other than cancer (ie: infection, etc.) but, better safe than sorry. We don't do mammograms, generally, in young women because breast tissue is too dense, and some doctors will even recommend an MRI instead of a mammogram. Best wishes to you for your diagnosis. Anita, RN, Breast Health Educator I hope youreceieve this message and reply soon. I am 43 yr old i have had a left breast discharge fro 2 years with not pain. I went to eight different doc. all told me don't worry.  I still have this greenish brown discharge pain that goes from my left breast under my arm to my shoulder. Mamo always showed nothing I did one ultasond saw the milk duct but told all women have this don't worry. went to new dr. did skull xray have several leiosn consist with met to brain from breast cnacer. Thurs. i did my forsdt MRI and Friday did my first bone scan. will have surgery on monday to remove all mile ducts, breast biopsy and biopsy any lympnodes if needed. can this actually be possible. Breast cancer runs very high in my family sister ( age 33 ) mother age 62 my sister had lyeomyoscarcoma passed away at 36. Is this how some people find out dr. ingored eveytime i went to them. I guess i will know more on monday until then i am on pins and needle.
Posts.Title: Could This be Breast Cancer?

Posts.Content: On 9/17/2007 never4get wrote: I am a nurse and my Mother was just diagnosed with stg 2b cancer; I'm not sure what to think about your doctors; number one- there are almost more false positives with pet and bone scans than there are with any test- (just to maybe help ease the burden) number 2; live in today- Today you are not having surgery, you are not in pain, you are not getting any bad (or good) news.  I would think they woould want core biopsies and a total MRI of the body, or at least a biopsy of something, but they maybe plan on taking a biopsy when they remove your milk ducts??but I wonder which one-there are numerous ducts in your breast.  Are they all milk ducts?? I dought it but I dont know.  My mother's breast cancer started in her duct, and has now that we found it invaded her breast and lymph system; we just don't/wont know how much until after her lymphectomy/mastectomy.  I hope you find out everything is absolutely nothing.   Thanks for your support. I do have pain and brownish green discharge in my left breast pain has gradually gotten worse, this has been going on for 2 years and 8 docotrs later. The pain goes over half my left breast up under my are and up to my shoulder collar bone. I will do a biospy when they remove the milk ducts no they fianlly saw it yesterday on a ultrasound MAMO'S  DO NOT SHOW UP ANYTHING. But I will call the docotr today to what he will do about my right breast. Thanks for your support and I will keep you and your mother in my prayers.
Posts.Title: MRI results postponed surgery Need any info

Posts.Content: I have posted early on 9/11/2007 that I was told I had met to the bone/brain consisted with breast cancer  becasue of some skull xrays that were taken. I have never been offically diagnosed with breast cancer but it runs very high in my family MOM and sister .  I did get a bone scan and a MRI. I was schedule to remove all the milk duct in my left breast and also so do a breast biopsy of my left breast. The docotr came in this morning and post poned the surgery becasue something showed up in th MRi and he wanted a ultrasound because of some things lit up in both breast and it was deep in the breast. So now i am looking at surgey onb Friday and I want him to also biospy the right breast too. Now I am all confused as to what showed up because the once again I keep hearing oh don't worry its nothing. This has been going on two years. Any info would be helpful.
Posts.Title: MRI results postponed surgery Need any info

Posts.Content: I wrote earlier about postponed surergy but i forgot to say the MRI showed light up ( or whatever it called ) in both breast same location on each breast but the doctor said that they finding were deep tissue. I was just wondering can breast cancer be like this.
Posts.Title: can breast cancer be in both breast
